revised_title: Mitochondrial 2-Oxoacid Dehydrogenase Complexes and Reversible Phosphorylation in Animal Tissues
tldr: The article discusses the biological roles of protein phosphorylation in mitochondrial 2-oxoacid dehydrogenase complexes of animal tissues. It focuses on the pyruvate and branched-chain 2-oxoacid dehydrogenase complexes and their regulation through reversible phosphorylation. The article explains how these complexes play a role in glucose degradation, branched-chain amino acid degradation, and the interconversion of the branched-chain complex in response to supply.
